item.title: Tarmac path with split on Redthorne Way, 22nd August
item.description:
The tarmac path has a wide split. Location is at the end of Redthorne Way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Redthorne Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Red crosses painted on highway markings., 22nd August
item.description:
Red paint has been painted on the white road markings at the roundabout. Junction of Alma Road and Caernarvon Road. GL51.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 86, Caernarvon Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 22nd August
item.description:
Customer requests that an "Unsuitable for Heavy Goods Vehicles" sign is installed at the location to warn drivers not to use Chandos Street to access North Street. An LGV has recently become stuck again between 55 and 53 North Street attempting to negotiate the turn; these two properties have also been struck be vehicles. They understand that this issue has been raised previously and there has been some discussion in relation to it; this is the first time they have reported it themselves.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)

item.title: Stile has been removed, and fences nailed across path, 22nd August
item.description:
On the Gloucestershire Way, first stile if walking footpath directly opposite entrance to Oxenton village. Can also be approached from Claydon.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oxenton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Builders depositing and leaving waste, 22nd August
item.description:
Builders at adjacent property leaving waste on public land. The road is Wellington Lane, Cheltenham

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Square, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: In wrong location, 22nd August
item.description:
The sign advising traffic that the A40 in Charlton Kings is closing for 4 months is too far down the A40 and needs to be before the traffic lights (Northleach - Cheltenham direction) as the diversion is going to take traffic down the Cirencester Road - therefore turning off at the Frogmill traffic lights. By the time the sign is seen, you have missed the turning!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Shipton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 22nd August
item.description:
Customer reporting 4 dead deer in this location in the last few weeks - they have requested some signage to indicate deer in the area. They are going to speak to NH about the rest of the A40.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)
